SSA2py Workflow

SSA2py was built keeping in mind that we want a simple but at the same time efficient workflow. For the automatic implementation of SSA2py:

1. Check for new events

We closely monitoring FDSNWS-event services trying to identify new seismic events. In case of a seismic event that complies to the user given criteria the SSA2py starts. Inside the configuration file there is a special section dedicated to event restrictions in order to avoid false triggers or mislocated seismic events.

2. Select Inventory/Waveforms

In a case of seismic event, SSA2py tries to gather all the available data/metadata information from various user given sources. For the metadata SSA2py can draw info from FDSNWS-station servises, local StationXML files or StationYAML files (yaml type files oriented mainly for manual SSA2py applications). For the waveforms SSA2py can look in Seedlink (near-real time application), FDSNWS-dataselect servises, data in SDS and MSEED format.

Erroneous waveforms can be discared from the proccess automatically by applying various quality check methods (SNR, CLIP, TIME).

3. Waveforms processing/Travel-Time tables

The user can easily adapt the SSA application based to his/her needs by using different waveforms processing approaches. We offer a variety of options for filtering, rotation, normalization, change waveforms type etc. Also we calculate the Travel-Time tables necessary for the SSA application. Except from the classical 1-D model implemenation SSA2py offers also 3-D velocity model option.

4. SSA Calculations

In the next step SSA2py calculates SSA in time for an adjustable 4-D grid. Uncertainty analysis tests can be performed (Jackknife, Bootstrap, Array Response Function) if the user enables these options.

5. Results analysis

Results analysis plots.
